DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study : - To validate interest classification use pragmatic application clinical predictive rule low back pain identify patient good prognosis follow brief spinal manipulation intervention . Patients ( n = 100 150 ) : Recruited emergency department Saint-Luc hospital medical doctor Inclusion criterion : A. Non-specific ( No red flag ) acute low back mobility deficit ( limitation bend ) pain duration < 16 day symptom distal knee , male female patient age 19-55 year . Exclusion criterion : - Specific LBP ( red flag ) radiate beyond knee - Low Back Pain Non-specific subacute chronic - Recurrent low back pain ( 3 painful episode ) - Lumbar instability hyper laxity ( instability catch , active straight leg raise ( SLR ) > 90° , aberrant movement , range motion ( ROM ) le low lumbar spine > 50° stand flexion ) , pregnancy post-partum status - High irritability = necessity opioid medication intravenous injection medication emergency department - previous history surgical intervention low back area Intervention : - 3 session within one week spinal manipulation ( thrust , grade V ) comparison : - 3 session false/sham manipulation ( placebo ) side lie thoraco-lumbar hinge grade II Co-intervention similar group : = traditional medical care ( TMC ) - Reassure patient , avoid bed rest , advise stay active take analgesic ( need paracetamol ) ( European Guidelines non-specific acute low back pain ; van Tulder et al . 2006 ; Koes et al . 2010 ) . Outcomes : Use effect size standardize mean difference . ANOVA one Two Way , number need treat ( NNT ) analysis intention treat analysis outcome variable : - Primary : Kinematic Variables : two index , logit score amplitude velocity ( Hidalgo et al. , 2012 ) patient 's expectation manual therapy ( MT ) treatment improve LBP - Secondary : Pain presentation visual analogical scale ( VAS ) repartition ( body diagram ) , Oswestry Disability Index ( ODI , questionnaire pain function ) , patient specific function ( PSF ) , fear avoidance belief questionnaire ( FABQ ) , Start back tool , physical examination , medication use , return work treatment side effect , patient 's belief real MT intervention ( end follow-up ) Study design : - Double blind ie : patient assessor blind . - The methodological quality study 8-9/10 PEDro scale , strictly follow CONSORT statement register clinical.trials gov Evaluators : Christine Detrembleur ( PT-PhD-UCL ) , Maxime Gilliaux ( PT-PhD-student-UCL ) Responsible study : Henri Nielens ( MD-PhD-UCL ) Practitioner investigator : Benjamin Hidalgo PE , PT-MT , DO , PhD-student Certificate Orthopedic Manual Therapy ( Manual Concepts , Curtin University ) Assistant-Professor Faculty Physical therapy ( FSM-UCL ) Belgium International collaborator : Timothy Flynn ( PT-PhD ) , Regis University , Denver , USA
DOC.brief_title: Study Efficacy Manual Therapy Subgroup Acute Non-specific Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: INTRODUCTION : Non-specific low back pain high prevalence within musculoskeletal disorder industrialized country ( Waddell 2004 ) . Many treatment available different degree effectiveness ( Delitto et al . 2012 ) . Many expert agree sub-groups exist within large category patient diagnose non-specific LBP . The difficulty identify pathoanatomical cause patient combined high false positive rate image study lead many conclude meaningful sub-groups base patient 's symptom clinical presentation ( Fritz et al ; 2005 ; Hidalgo et al . 2012 , 2013a , b ) . The identification subgroup could improve outcomes clinical care establish accurate prognosis , efficiently direct patient therapy likely benefit particular sub-group ( Fritz et al . 2005 ; Delitto et al . 2012 ) . Orthopaedic Manual Therapy ( OMT ) play increasingly important role treatment back pain , especially patient factor predict favorable response TMO ( Delitto et al . 2012 , Fritz et al . 2005 ) . One propose subgroup among non-specific LBP people identify patient respond rapidly spinal manipulation positive clinical predictive rule ( 4-5/ 5 criterion ) ( Flynn et al . 2002 , Child et al . 2004 , Fritz et al . 2005 ) . However common sense , well research evidence recognize patient LBP expect respond manipulation intervention . The efficiency primary care management patient LBP could improve pragmatic tool could help identify patient LBP likely respond hand approach . In study Fritz et al . 2005 , author demonstrate 2 easy clinical criterion sufficient identify subgroup among non-specific LBP ( duration symptom < 16 day distribution symptom : symptom distal knee ) . However , methodological quality study physical therapy often good say , sparse good level 1 A B ( double blind : term patient evaluator blind ) . As Level 1 A study validate pragmatic application clinical prediction rule primary care identify patient LBP good prognosis follow brief spinal manipulation intervention .
